00020 
00021 #ifndef KM_CENTERS_H
00022 #define KM_CENTERS_H
00023 
00024 #include "KMeans.h"            // kmeans includes
00025 #include "KMdata.h"            // provides KMdata
00026 
00027 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 //  KMcenters - set of centers
00029 //    This object encodes the information needed for describing a set
00030 //    of centers.  It also stores a pointer to the data set.
00031 //
00032 //    When copying this object, we allocate new storage for the center
00033 //    points, but we just copy the pointer to the data set.
00034 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 
00036 class KMcenters {
00037 protected:
00038     int            kCtrs;        // number of centers
00039     KMdata*        pts;        // the data points
00040     KMcenterArray    ctrs;        // the centers
00041 public:                    // constructors, etc.
00042     KMcenters(int k, KMdata& p);    // standard constructor
00043     KMcenters(const KMcenters& s);    // copy constructor
00044                     // assignment operator
00045     KMcenters& operator=(const KMcenters& s);
00046     virtual ~KMcenters();        // virtual destructor
00047 public:                    // accessors
00048     int getDim() const {        // get dimension
00049     return pts->getDim();
00050     }
00051     int getNPts() const {        // get number of points
00052     return pts->getNPts();
00053     }
00054     int getK() const {            // get number of centers
00055     return kCtrs;
00056     }
00057     KMdata& getData() {            // get the data point structure
00058     return *pts;
00059     }
00060     KMpointArray getDataPts() const {    // get the data point array
00061     return pts->getPts();
00062     }
00063     KMcenterArray getCtrPts() const {    // get the center points
00064     return ctrs;
00065     }
00066     KMcenter& operator[](int i) {    // index centers
00067     return ctrs[i];
00068     }
00069     const KMcenter& operator[](int i) const {
00070     return ctrs[i];
00071     }
00072     void resize(int k);            // resize array
00073 
00074     virtual void print(            // print centers
00075         bool fancy = true);
00076 };
00077 #endif
